revised_title: Isotope Effects in the Absorption and Diffusion of Hydrogen and Deuterium in Tantalum at Low Temperatures
tldr: The authors studied the absorption and diffusion of hydrogen and deuterium in tantalum at low temperatures. They observed large isotope effects and found that the ratio of diffusion coefficients for hydrogen and deuterium was approximately 220 at 78 K, which diminished as the temperature increased. The results suggest that quantum mechanical tunnelling occurs between adjacent sites in the tantalum lattice.
